Ivan Illich, an Austrian Catholic priest-turned-philosopher, wrote a book called "Tools for Conviviality" in 1973. Illich argued that technology has been at the expense of our capability as autonomous beings.

articles.title: The quest for AI 'scientific superintelligence'
articles.author: Steve Lohr
articles.summary: Experts agree that the big AI opportunity lies in accelerating and transforming scientific discovery and development. AI promises to generate new drugs to combat disease, new agriculture to feed the world's population and materials to unlock green energy in a fraction of the time of traditional research.

articles.title: AI's Linguistic Diversity Battle: Mind Your Language
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Sundar Pichai announced at the Artificial Intelligence Action Summit in Paris that Google added 110 new languages to Google Translate last year. It was achieved after two years of behind-the-scenes negotiations in the arcane world of digital diplomacy. Joseph Nkalwo Ngoula is digital policy advisor at the UN mission of the International Organisation of La Francophonie.

articles.title: Meta Continues to Integrate AI Bot Profiles into its Apps
articles.author: Andrew Hutchinson
articles.summary: Facebook, Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp are adding AI features to their apps. It's all part of Meta's AI re-shaping of in-app conversations in order to drive more overall engagement in its apps through automated characters. The company plans to integrate millions of AI-powered profiles into Facebook and IG.

articles.title: Just a heads-up: it's best not to ask ChatGPT about yourself
articles.summary: AlgaeRancher, IamRat, Gubbo, Cretinbob, Johnphantom, Kbronsito and others are discussing chatgpt and AI. They are critical of the fact that Chatgpt can lie all the time.

articles.title: Top AI Stocks to Buy During Nasdaq Correction Right Now
articles.author: support101@QUE.com
articles.summary: The Nasdaq has experienced market fluctuations recently. AI technology is revolutionizing various industries, from healthcare to finance, and from manufacturing to entertainment. AI is at the forefront of numerous technological advancements, driving demand across sectors. The global AI market is projected to grow exponentially, offering vast opportunities for companies leading the charge. AI stocks have shown resilience even during volatile market conditions and bounce back stronger after corrections.

articles.title: Augmented Reality and AI Revolutionizing the Retail Industry: A Transformative Journey
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: In today's competitive retail landscape, businesses are under constant pressure to maximize profit margins and boost productivity. The rapid adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) promises to revolutionize retail operations, streamlining processes and driving revenue growth. Augmented reality (AR) is rapidly transforming the way consumers interact with products and brands.

articles.title: The Gaping Hole In Today's AI Capabilities
articles.author: Rob Toews
articles.summary: The pace of improvement in artificial intelligence today is breathtaking. Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei believes we're on track for human-level AI systems that surpass humans in every task within 2-3 years. Today's AI systems go through two distinct phases: training and inference. Human cognition is not divided into separate 'training' and 'inference' phases. The advent of continual learning will have profound implications for the world of AI.

articles.title: How To Use AI To Build Financial Independence
articles.author: Jaime Catmull
articles.summary: In the past, starting a business was expensive, but today costs have dropped. AI-powered software development platforms allow businesses to build applications at a fraction of the traditional cost. For freelancers, solo entrepreneurs and small business owners, AI-driven tools can provide several financial advantages.

articles.title: Beyond Today's Smart Cities: Building A Multimodal Metropolis
articles.author: Cathy Hackl
articles.summary: The future of cities isn't just smart, it's mutimodal and multi-agent. As AI-driven infrastructure takes hold, cities are evolving into dynamic, self-regulating ecosystems where technology works in harmony with human activity. Neom's master plan envisions a fully AI-integrated city that uses predictive urban modeling, generative AI for sustainability, and hyper-connected infrastructure. Qiddiya aims to create a seamless digital hub with AR smart glasses.

articles.title: When AI Takes Over Scientific Discovery
articles.author: Craig S. Smith
articles.summary: Sakana AI's AI system from Japan's Sakana AI generated a hypothesis, designed experiments and wrote a peer-rerviewed scientific paper on its conclusions without human intervention. The paper was accepted as a Spotlight Paper at ICLR 2025, one of the most prestigious machine learning gatherings. Sakana.AI withdrew the paper before the conference.

articles.title: Business Tech News: How To Build A Website In 30 Minutes Using AI
articles.author: Gene Marks
articles.summary: Carly Quellman tried to build a website using AI and it only took 30 minutes. Wix's AI-powered tools promise to create functional websites in just 30 minutes and other web hosting platforms are rolling out AI tools to do the same. Verizon Business has introduced a Generative AI assistant tailored for small businesses. JotForm AI Agents aim to streamline processes and enhance productivity. Microsoft is working on a feature that will alert users if their PC's performance is wearing down.

articles.title: David Cronenberg on 'The Brutalist' AI controversy: We mess with actors' voices all the time
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: The backlash against "The Brutalist" for using AI to enhance Adrien Brody's voice is nothing but a campaign against the movie, according to director David Cronenberg. He believes it's not a good idea to use AI in this way.

articles.title: Business Tech News: How To Build A Website In 30 Minutes Using AI
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Wix and other web hosting providers are using AI to make website design easier. Zoom, Verizon and JotForm are rolling out AI agents to automate processes.    i.e. AI agents are agents that can be programmed to perform specific tasks.

articles.title: ACI conference in Dubai discusses green concrete and advances in construction technology
articles.author: Khaleejtimes
articles.summary: The conference organised by the American Concrete Institute (ACI) in Dubai concluded its two-day proceedings. The event attracted over 300 experts and researchers from 14 different countries and resulted in several key recommendations related to concrete technology and sustainability. The conference covered topics such as Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and ACI 562: The Future of Concrete Technology in Assessment and Repair.

articles.title: Anthropic adds web search to its Claude chatbot
articles.author: Business Ghana
articles.summary: Anthropic's AI-powered chatbot, Claude, can now search the web. Web search is available now in preview for paid Claude users in the U.S., with support for free users and additional countries coming soon. Users can toggle on web search in their profile.

articles.title: 'I thought my symptoms were being caused by anxiety and grief - but then Chat ...
articles.author: Manchester Evening News
articles.summary: She put her symptoms into Chat GPT and it told her she has blood cancer. She is afraid she might have cancer. Her symptoms were confirmed by chat chat GPT. She has a blood cancer, according to the chat chat results.    She has cancer.

articles.title: Finding AI unhelpful? Reid Hoffman says you're not trying hard enough.
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Reid Hoffman uses AI to learn new topics and assess companies as an investor. He believes everyone should be able to find a way to make AI useful for them, despite the hype. He uses AI for learning and informing potential investments.    "Frankly, if you haven't found something where it's useful to you, about something you care about, then you're not trying hard enough"

articles.title: Don't let the states derail America's AI revolution
articles.author: The Hill
articles.summary: The hottest artificial intelligence (AI) innovation news of 2025 is coming out of China, with cutting-edge products like DeepSeek R1 and Manus. This is a wake-up call for the United States, which was previously thought to be ahead of the world.

articles.title: Steve Jobs Predicted The Future Of AI Before Most Of Us Were Even Born
articles.author: News18
articles.summary: Steve Jobs once spoke about having a machine that could understand and respond like a real person. Today, chatbots such as ChatGPT are similar to the AI chatbots used by Steve Jobs and others. It is possible to create a chatbot similar to this one.

articles.title: Across China: AI pediatrician to enter more grassroots hospitals in China
articles.author: Xinhua
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) pediatrician has won widespread recognition since its debut at Beijing Children's Hospital in February. The hospital unveiled the country's first pediatric large-scale AI model under the name "The Basic Version targets daily pediatric care and the Expert Version addresses complex and rare diseases.

articles.title: Confluence of creativity, marketing and AI
articles.author: Business Line
articles.summary: Adobe Summit in Las Vegas saw over 12,000 attendees, mostly from the marketing community. It was the 23rd edition of the glitzy conference, which is all about digital experiences. Adobe talked about its vision and approach to agentic AI and launched a whole new product.

articles.title: The historical figures who inspired Nvidia's product names, from Grace Hopper to David Blackwell
articles.author: system
articles.summary: The names of Nvidia's AI chips take inspiration from pioneering figures in math and science. The company has a history of naming its products after STEM pioneers and their works of science and technology.    i.e. mathematicians, scientists, engineers, etc.

articles.title: DOGE and (mis)understanding AI
articles.author: Resilience
articles.summary: AI will solve all of our major problems or cause.    for some of them, but not all of them.  For others, it will solve some of their major problems. for others, or cause  for them. for some other reason.

articles.title: Ex-NSA boss: Good news. Election security focus helped dissuade increase in Russian meddling with US
articles.author: The Register
articles.summary: Plus AI in the infosec world, why CISA should know its place and more. CISA is a cyber-security agency that promotes the use of artificial intelligence in the IT industry.  .       "CISA" is an acronym for CISA.

articles.title: When AI Takes Over Scientific Discovery
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: The First Fully AI-Generated Peer-Reviewed Scientific Paper: A Turning Point in the Age of AI is being called the first peer-reviewed AI-generated scientific paper. It is written by AI-generated peer-reviewers. It's published by MIT Press.

articles.title: Google is rolling out Gemini's real-time AI video features
articles.author: The Verge
articles.summary: Google has started rolling out new AI features to Gemini Live that let it'see' your screen or through your smartphone camera and answer questions about it in real-time. The features come nearly a year after Google first demonstrated the 'Project Astra' and are available to Gemini Advanced Subscribers as part of the Google One AI Premium plan.

articles.title: The Rise of Multitasking Robots in 2025 Is Backed By AI
articles.author: Technowize Magazine
articles.summary: All eyes are on AI and chatbots powered by them, but we aren't talking enough about the quiet rise of multitasking robots in 2025. Gimmick-heavy robots like the Optimus Tesla Bot have made us skeptical about the potential of robotics to get us closer to humanoid assistants.

articles.title: Students expelled from university in Lithuania for improper AI use
articles.author: China.dot.org
articles.summary: Ten students from Vilnius University were expelled last year for violating rules on artificial intelligence (AI) use. AI is not banned, but some students do not always use it responsibly, according to the report. They were expelled for improperly using AI in their work.

articles.title: Samsung One UI 7 Will Arrive Next Month With Smarter AI
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: The phone software uses artificial intelligence to help you edit videos, write messages and get recommendations on where to go for dinner. It's free and available for Android and iOS devices. It can be downloaded from the Google Play Store or from Apple's App Store.

articles.title: Next-generation AI hardware: 3D photonic-electronic platform boosts efficiency and bandwidth
articles.author: Phys Dot Org
articles.summary: Researchers at Columbia Engineering have unveiled a 3D photonic-electronic platform that achieves unprecedented energy efficiency and high-bandwidth-Density Chip Data Links for AI systems. The platform is based on the 3D Photonics for Ultra-Low Energy, High Bandwidth/Densely-densely Connected Chip.

articles.title: AI, immersive storytelling and the Olympics
articles.author: Inside The Games
articles.summary: Aditya Aditya is the Head of Media Business Strategy & Intelligence at the IOC. He believes that Artificial Intelligence could be used to enhance the fan experience of sport. He thinks AI could help to ensure that fans hear the voice of a leading commentator.

articles.title: Does "vibe coding" make everyone a programmer?
articles.author: Lionel BONAVENTURE
articles.summary: Javascript is required for you to be able to read premium content on ChatGPT. It is part of the BLOX Digital Content Exchange. It's the latest Silicon Valley catchphrase for an advance in generative AI that some say makes computer programming as simple as chatting online.

articles.title: Does "vibe coding" make everyone a programmer?
articles.author: Lionel BONAVENTURE
articles.summary: "Vibe coding" is the latest Silicon Valley catchphrase for an advance in generative AI that some say makes computer programming as simple as chatting online. Javascript is required for you to be able to read premium content on ChatGPT. It's recommended that you enable it in your browser settings.
